result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: allowing Mr. Cruz to withdraw

Attorney Domingo S. Cruz in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Defense motions the Court to withdraw. Mr. Cruz has not had any contact with the deft and any mail the Court has sent to the deft has been returned as undeliverable.

BTC: Mr. Cruz may withdraw. BW remains. Mr. Lopez was here but was allowed to leave given the fact that the deft did not appear
Motion hearing at 02-15-2016 09:30 am
Motion hearing at 02-15-2016 01:30 pm
In support of motion.
ATTY Cruz filing motion to withdraw.
Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture to deft - Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward.

Defendant Daniel Ramirez-Huzar not in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant.
The State moves for judgment for bond forf

BTC: bond forf granted

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. MISSED HEARING 10/15/15 CASH BOND $750.00

Attorney Domingo S. Cruz in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
BTC:   No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
Domingo Cruz
Preliminary hearing at 10-15-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, RGT (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Daniel Ramirez-Huzar in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Daniel Ramirez-Huzar in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Interpreter, Rick Kissell, appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance at 10-06-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Daniel Ramirez-Huzar in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Daniel Ramirez-Huzar in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
